author: Staff Reporter
text: Members of the Maharashtra Gold and Silver Melting Association, North Arcot, have launched an indefinite strike from Monday demanding the Central Government to withdraw the proposed one per cent excise duty. R. Vijay, secretary of the association, said there are nearly 500 gold and silver melting shops in North Arcot districts. “We had protested along with jewellers too. Now, gold and silver melting shops across the country, including in West Bengal and Mumbai, have downed their shutters in protest. We have joined the protest from Monday,” he said.
title: Gold, silver melting units down shutters for duty roll back
